New Records: Cade Smith struck out 12 batters in the ALDS, setting a new MLB record for a reliever in a division series.
Cade Smith became the first pitcher in Cleveland history to appear in all five games of a division series.
Steven Kwan became the first Cleveland player and third in MLB history to collect three hits or more in three straight postseason games.
Steven Kwan extended his playoff hitting streak to 10 games, matching Kenny Lofton in 1995 for the franchise record.
Steven Kwan's 11 hits in the ALDS are a new club record for a single division series.
Steven Kwan's 20 hits are the most by a Cleveland player through 12 career playoff games, passing Kenny Lofton's 18 in 1995.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the fifth inning, made possible by Steven Kwan's one-out base hit off Skubal.
Cade Smith entered Game 5 in the third inning, the earliest he had ever appeared in a major league game.
Post-Match Reflections: Steven Kwan reflected on his success in the postseason, attributing it to executing his plan at the plate.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Steven Kwan, calling him the 'engine' for Cleveland that 'creates a lot of pressure.'
Cade Smith expressed that he is not taking a second of the playoff experience for granted, highlighting the team's resilience and ability to compete.
